name: Robert Hughes
text:
Don't be misled by the 4 and 5 star reviews, this place is rough and the staff are rude.  I used to be a regular plasma donor at CSL a few years ago but haven't had time until recently.  I'm on a break between semesters so I thought I'd make a donation (you know, towards those life saving therapies) and make a little money.

I gathered all of the required documents, per Ked's website, and arrived at their donation center early.  First impression- rough.  People loitering outside shouting at passersby or donors as they enter.  The parking lot and building are disgustingly unkempt with litter and trash strewn about.

I approached the new donor side and met a joyless, rude employee who very obviously didn't want to process a new donor.  She rattled off a list of documents hoping I was missing an item so she wouldn't have to do her job.  "License?"  Check.  "Social Security card?"  Check.  "Utility bill?"  Two of them, check.

"Something else with your social on it?" Nope, you got me.  All I have is the document the Federal government issued to me that is accepted EVERYWHERE.  "W-2?"  Nope, I'm a graduate student.

Apparently the list of documents that Ked says is acceptable isn't acceptable if the bouncer at the front desk doesn't want to do her job.  I could drive home, print tax documents (like my 1098-T) and return... but I'm sure she'd find another reason not to do her job.

So I'm going to go donate whole blood to LifeSouth.  I'd rather give my blood away for free, knowing that it goes toward a good cause, and be treated with dignity than ever return to Ked again.  And if any other students (or anyone for that matter) ask about donating plasma I'll point them to Biomat.

text: My husband and I showed up and signed a clipboard and checked new donor. An hour later we were told we needed to sign in on another clipboard for new donors. We filled put some paperwork that included a medication list and then my husband was given an appointment an hour and a half later and mine was 2 hours later. No mention of any medicine disqualifying us to donate. We go eat and come back to wait another 2 hours before being told we did not qualify due to being on Metformin. The nurse was very apologetic and tried to get us an inconvenience fee, but apparently they quit giving those out last month. We wasted the majority of a day trying to donate. All they would have had to do was have a sign at the desk for new donors to talk to an employee and then have the nurse look over the medicine list before scheduling an appointment for the new donor. If you want to waste your day try to donate, but there are much better ways for me to utilize my time.

name: Allie Bradfield
text:
Staff has always been pretty friendly when I've tried to donate. However this is getting a low rating for a few reasons. When I first went I was completely honest (best thing to do right?) While documenting my tattoos and piercings one of the questions I was asked was about self harm. I told the truth including that I hadn't done it in about 10-11 months. I was deferred for a year because it had to be six months since the last time. I had already been there for 6 hours. I felt so bad when I left.
The next time I went (a year later) I was informed my hygiene was bad and they wouldn't accept me because of that. I had a shower before I went. Also, told that due to my meds I needed my family doctor to fill out a form so I could donate. I was on the same meds the first time I went. The staff who checks your iron and no are friendly. Once your in that room for a physical it hasn't been as polite iny case. I gave up trying to donate with them. Since I'm not doing it for money I go donate with Life south.

name: Douglas W Smith
text: My wife and i both went here to donate and as we first walked in the staff appeared to be in good spirits which is always a good experience to encounter but it did not last long as she was told she didnt have any good veins and was rejected as a donor. I know she has good veins because not only are we repeated donors at lifesouth but we have to have blood drawn before each Dr. visit. They made her wait outside in the van using requirements as an excuse. Then when i explained that i was familiar with the procedure of donating plasma since i usually donate to lifesouth without pay they rolled their eyes and started criticizing and downgrading them which in my opinion is being judgmental and kinda makes kedplasma look pretty bad and childish. They had me to go through the entire process of watching videos and creating an account before testing my blood and telling me that my protein level was too high by one point. After having it tested by the Dr. Only to find out it wasnt high at all which tells me that they could possibly be giving out bad test results to others either by faulty equipment or on purpose. In either event i have decided that we will not be returning to this facility just in case it's faulty equipment.

You may donate twice a week with at least one day in between donations. Example: Monday and Wednesday would be acceptable.

name: Elliot Wise
text:
(Reviewing under an alias so I do not out myself)

Don't go here.
The staff is unprofessional. Their doctor hasn't been in in two weeks and no one can tell me when they're there, but I'm on hold for some unknown reason until they get it together.

I am a trans man and am male-passing (have been for years) and still get "ma-am"d by their staff every time I go in because there's zero trans competency and all the staff does is look at the paper that aligns with your license.

There are about three staff members who have it together and actually pay attention, but other than those select few, everyone else is not good. I won't be returning; they can meet their quotas with someone else's plasma and time.

Tl;dr
This center does not know what they're doing, and (especially if you're trans) don't go.

text: I LOVE the staff here.  Julia, Naka, Shan, Sharmin, Glenda, Charles, Pam, Julie, Mr. Emmett,  and the list goes on, but they are all very nice.  I don't know all of their names but could name off several more if I did. They will cut up with you and make you feel comfortable while still being professional.  I have read the reviews on here, and in my experience with this Grifols location for over a year now, I have had a couple of times where my money was not deposited or I got the wrong amount, however, when I called them, they looked into it and it was taken care of in a timely manner.  They are only human as we are and they are processing a lot of people daily, and mistakes are expected but not typical here.  I have also encountered a couple of people who were somewhat rude, however, I do not judge the center as a whole off of the few.  I know that if they keep up that behavior they will not last long at this job, as Mr. Emmett is all about customer service and taking care of his donors. text: My first experience wasn't the worst but it wasn't the best. It took entirely to long. ( past the 2 hours they tell you) There was in issues with my machine, I had been on the bed for over two hours and wasn't even half way finished. After I felt I was about to pass out I called for help. The ladies was really nice In helping me, that is until some white lady came over and was basically telling me it was all my fault. I'm not sure of her name but she's normally at the front desk. I think she acts as the nurse. But the actual nurse was very nice and helpful. The other lady is always very rude and disrespectful. I don't like the way she talks to us like we are literate or like everyone is on drugs or something.i only started going because it was a grade for a class. I've stop going on serval different occasions simply because of her. I feel belittled every time she says something. It jus makes for a bad experience when she's one of the first people you come in contact with. There have been other situations as to why I will never go. Like lying about the money they will pay or not honoring the bonus they send in the mail. Moral of the story, just go somewhere else, save your self the headache.

text: My experience been good at Plasma Donation Center & somewhat of a friendly staff. 😉😊

text: I really love the energy at this location. The staff is the best.

name: Shufon Wood
text: I had the most horrendous visit with this facility today. I'll start back to a couple of days ago I came in (right before close) as soon as I finished on the kiosk I get called to the back, despite the fact that there were multiple people ahead of me I go to get screened and a few minutes later she tells me my hemo-something is to low. I say what's that meaning, as in do I need to drink more water, eat iron or what? She rudly says that means you can't donate. I leave feeling like I was lied to in order for the staff to get off work on time, but I still come back today. Today I get called in to be screened by the same girl from Last time, I go back to the desk and POLITELY ask for another screener because she made me a little uncomfortable the last time. They agree but not before allowing the other screener to approach me like she wanted to fight and says " you gotta problem". Very unprofessional I thought. I get the new screener which is a Caucasian girl with glasses, I can tell she was young because she was very defensive about the other screeners behavior as if the way I felt didn't matter. Not once was she understanding of what I was saying. Everytime I would start to explain she would cut me off very condescendingly and argumentative like I did something wrong or made her uncomfortable. Mind you this is a supervisor who not once said, I'm sorry you feel that way, what can we do? I got so fustrated, still as calm as can be an say "you are very defensive and are not listening to what I'm saying so if I'm done I'll just meet you at the door. She obviously angry, says your being hostel so I'm cancelling your visit. I asked well how am I being hostel? She says your being very disrespectful so I'm gonna have to ask you to leave. I ask what did I say that made you feel disrespected? she continues to say I'm gonna have to ask you to leave. I ask to speak to the person above her and she quickly says he's in a interview call back later. These employees need a class on customer/donor service. Just because I'm getting this little bit of change for my donation doesn't give you the right to treat or talk to me anyway.

name: Zulu Musa
text: They talk to you like you are nothing for $20. Stenphie Lee the director walks the center screaming at her employees and degrades the donors. If you are desperate and have no dignity this is the place for you. You can tell someone character by how they treat others who can not do anything for them. Stenphie Lee has horrible character stay away from this place go else where

name: Vincent Bersanti
text: About the same as any other "ghetto" donation center. Slow, rude, unprofessional, ect... the receptionists act unapproachable for any questions. I see most* employees goofin' off playing around & enjoying a lil' personal chitchat than opposed to working to process people..

name: Crystal Pettway
text: I wish there was a way to post zero stars. My husband and I are long time donors,but will not be back. My husband has been told twice he"clotted off" and blamed his,even though the needle backed out of the vein so there was no blood to pull,and they are the ones who allow blood to sit stagnant in the line for several minutes while they drift around the floor and eventually make their way back over to try and stick the other arm. There are 4 other patients who have had the same experience in the last couple of weeks,and the same thing happened to me today. When a crop of new faces appear in the phleb pool,and bam every other patient is suddenly "clotting off" or who's veins all of a sudden "ain't no good" shouldn't that tell you something?? AND you call your patient a liar to their face when they relate to you what they have just watched happen to their arm?? 2 long time donors gone.

name: Desire Scott
text: Workers here are very rude and have no communication structure , came for my second vist and they were so rude. Employee was black. They wanted my address to be proven which I wasn't aware of it , came in before 8 people and got treated like I wasn't a memeber , I have been a grifols memeber for 9 years and this is the worst one this employer needs to be talked to our fired very unprofessional. Her name is pam.

name: Marcus Edwards
text: Great experience. Great people.

name: Mrz Perry
text:
The LIES they tell! I was suckered into donating plasma supposedly to help people live so I came when they opened at 8a.m. Since I was a new donor to THIS company the website informed me it would take about 2.5 hours for the full process and to be patient. I am patient. What I am NOT cool with is seeing exactly how many people work here and how little is actually getting done. It is now 11a.m. and I have just made it to a donating chair surrounded by women taking about holiday plans and shopping trips. HELLO some of us would like to not be here for closing! I was told I can't leave so now my stomach is growing because I've been being patient since 8 am. Honestly I used to donate a lot but it became more of a burden on recent years than helpful to me so I haven't come back in years. They're going to pay me $50 today for plasma they can't use because I will NOT be back.

*** UPDATE *** It is now May and I was contacted by a member of management concerning my bad experience almost 6 months ago. I wasn't actually able to donate because the untrained phlebotomist Jasmine had punctured my vein and blood was everywhere so the got me off the table and out the door with 50 bucks not telling me ANYTHING about how to care for my carved up arm. When I got home I took the bandage off and it was purplish. I iced it thought I would be fine, no it bruised enough to cover the entire inside of my arm and elbow. I went back to show them they thought I was trying to donate and turned me away so I washed my hands of it. 6 months later in may NEW management with the SAME staff calls me to tell me they will pay me the new donor fee of 50 plus the 70 I WOULD'VE made had Jasmine not messed up my arm. So I go back. Jasmine is still there and the new mngmnt lied to get me there. I was one week out side being a new donor, so I only got 20 plus 70 but no prob right I just won't let Jasmine anywhere near me. (She tried to help but I was like NO she devil stay FAR away!) So I got a different sticker and she did fine but tried a new vein I had never used before but it seemed fine till it was time to put blood back then my whole arm started hurting. I made it up in my mind then no matter how much she calls or sends letters I'm NEVER going back. Then I get home and take the bandage off 5 hours later and a golf ball sized lump is under my skin. I panicked and called them back they said ice it and it should be fine. That was a week ago and I STILL have no strength in my arm. NOW my arm has bruised outrageously AGAIN. The messed up part though is the FACT that it's summer time so I'm having to wear sleeves to hide THEIR mistakes. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE don't go to these butchers! I know sometimes life gets hard but your LIFE is worth so much more than a punk a$$ 20 dollars. Stay FAR FAR FAR away from this place!

name: Kira'Cole Harris
text: I accompanied my husband down to the center for support as this would have been his second time donating. Our first overall experience was very pleasant as far as the actual donating of his plasma. Unfortunately the customer service we received was UNACCEPTABLE but we were grateful for the compensation. We also respected the possibility of knowing we could actually safe a life. On our second visit (which was within the same week) my husband was informed that our address was not accepted and he would have to provide mail from a different address in order to donate presently and in the future. We returned to the location 3 different times with mail from his mother's address whom he had resided at and currently still does from time to time when we are in a bind. All the mail was unacceptable. At this point I intervened into the situation asking to speak to a Manager whom I felt would give us a more detailed explanation of  information required of us.  This is where my whole experience turned negative plus. An African American customer service rep with long black braids name Yvette (I believe) was standing at the counter with a young gentleman representative when we approached to ask for a Manager. The young gentleman politely informed me he would get someone to assist me. He exited the area to wards Tha back (I'm thinking) to go get a Manager. The representative Yvette stayed at the counter inputting keystrokes into the computer terminal she was standing in front of. I proceeded to discuss with my husband that he should always ask for a Manager if he is not understanding what is being requested of him. While I'm talking I look over toward the back waiting for a Manager and I see Yvette totally engaged in our conversation as she was looking directly at us. I involved her into the conversation for her input b/c she is an employee at this center. I asked her if she understood what we were asking of them. She rudely responded "No I don't, but I hear you talking." I told her okay nevermind & thank u. She replied. "I know that's real." Then proceeded to grab paperwork off the counter and walk away laughing. I responded with a mimick of her laugh. Three minutes later she returned calling my husband's name requesting him to meet her in one of the consultation rooms. I could hear their entire conversation from the waiting area. She, Yvette (the same representative whom earlier had no input nor help on our situation, informed him he needed a post office marked letter or an unopened piece of mail addressed to him from a different address. We left went and got another piece of mail for the fourth time. We returned an hour later to find out that unopened mail without a post mark was unacceptable. At this point my husband was given a blank envelope and told to mail himself a piece of mail to the address and this would be acceptable. In my hesitation we agreed to do so. We got the mail the next day and returned to the center. He was informed that they also needed a utility bill in his name from his Mom's address. We left and decided that was enough for us. We will never recommend this particular location to anyone. The rep Yvette is rude discourteous and unprofessional and we will not tolerate this type of behavior in any business endeavor we participate in. FIND ANOTHER LOCATION, IN THE END YOU WILL APPRECIATE ME.

name: Richard Parker
text: I have never in my 45 years of living has been to a more disorganized place. PERIOD After 6 hrs first time, I went back, gave "head of the line" pass 2 hours later I got to the counter girl glanced at my arms nope cant do it. I had this on my arm last time,  nope. Next 2 times the same. One time gave head of line pass, I left after 1 and half why waste it. Finally I call managment, sure that's ok you can give. Its not where you get stuck. Told him what happen. Im gonna get you ahead of the line pass today give you an extra one. Hour and half later ge walks out, I throw my hands up, I get walked back. Suppose to get 50 first 5 times today after my 7th visit but only 3 time able to give. Got paid 20 bucks now more time wasted got to call. WHAT IS SO HARD? Ridiculous. I dont do this. This is the first reveiw ever.

resp.text: Customer service is very important to Octapharma Plasma, and we hope you will give us a second chance. First time donors will need to have a current, valid photo ID, proof of your Social Security number (original Social Security Card acceptable), and proof of address. For more information on acceptable identification documents, visit http://octapharmaplasma.com/donor/first-time-donors .

resp.text: Octapharma Plasma works hard to staff each of our donation centers with courteous, respectful, and professional employees. Please speak with your local donation center management so we can address and solve any of your concerns moving forward.

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear about your experience. All Octapharma Plasma center staff are trained through a rigorous, regulated program. Most people do not experience any side effects from donating plasma, but if you are we recommend that you consult with your medical professional. Your health and safety should come first. Thank you for your life saving plasma donation.
